field.label: Tag [set]
field.help: Optional tag to set for requests matching this range which can be used to selectively match dhcp options

field.label: Start address
field.help: Start of the range, e.g. 192.168.1.100 for DHCPv4, 2000::1 for DHCPv6 or when a constructor is used a partial like ::1. To reveal IPv6 related options, enter a IPv6 address. When using router advertisements, it is possible to use a constructor with :: as the start address and no end address.

field.label: Constructor
field.help: Interface to use to calculate the proper range, when selected, a range maybe specified as partial (e.g. ::1, ::400)

field.label: Prefix length (ipv6)
field.help: Prefix length offered to the client.

field.label: RA Mode
field.help: Control how IPv6 clients receive their addresses. Off means no RA messages are sent for this range.

field.label: Mode
field.help: Mode flags to set for this range, 'static' means no addresses will be automatically assigned.

field.label: Lease time
field.help: Defines how long the addresses (leases) given out by the server are valid (in seconds)

field.label: Domain
field.help: Offer the specified domain to machines in this range.

field.label: Disable HA sync
field.help: Ignore this range from being transfered or updated by ha sync.

field.label: Description
field.help: You may enter a description here for your reference (not parsed).
